In printing and publishing, a proof copy is the preliminary version of a publication, after the inclusion of any author corrections following review, and after copy editing and formatting to bring the manuscript into the house style, intended for final checking prior to publication to detect and eliminate typographical errors, omissions or transpositions of text, incorrect layout or placement of illustrations and tables, or other formatting errors. Those who check proofs include the editor, possibly the peer-reviewers (to ensure that their requested modifications have been included to their satisfaction), possibly an in-house professional proof-reader, and / or the author, who is ultimately responsible for ensuring the published work says what (s)he means it to say. Substantive changes to the text are not permitted once the manuscript has reached proof stage.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: proof

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A rewritable data storage medium that is composed of a disk of thin, flexible (floppy) magnetic storage medium encased in a square or rectangular plastic shell. Data are encoded magnetically by a read/write head that float on a cushion of air in close proximity to the surface of the rotated disk.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: floppy disk

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Metadata describing the work itself, including for example the name of the creator(s), the title of the work, and the date and place of its creation.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: entity metadata

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An analog sound storage medium consisting of a flat disc made of moulded vinyl plastic with an inscribed, modulated spiral groove.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: vinyl disk

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The report of a trial, for example an experimental trial or a legal trial.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: trial report

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A periodical, usually devoted to a particular topic or domain of interest, and usually published weekly or monthly, consisting primarily of non-peer reviewed editorials, journalistic news items and more substantive articles, reviews, book reviews and discussions concerning current or recent events and publications, and matters of interest to the domain served by the magazine. [Some scientific journals, notably Science and Nature, also secondarily serve as science magazines by containing substantive editorials and news items on vital or controversial issues].
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: magazine

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A written review and critical analysis of the content, scope and quality of a book or other monographic work.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: book review
dust jacket
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A detachable outer cover, usually made of paper and printed with text and illustrations. This outer cover has folded flaps that hold it to the cover of a document.
The number defining an international standard, for example Z39.96 - 201x, identifying NISO JATS, the Journal Article Tag Suite.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has standard number

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A recorded static visual representation. This class of image includes diagrams, drawings, graphs, graphic designs, plans, maps, photographs and prints.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: still image
digital magnetic tape
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A rewritable digital medium for magnetic recording of audio, video and other data, made of a thin magnetizable coating on a long, narrow strip of plastic, usually wound on a spool.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has translated title
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A version of the title of an entity translated into another language, which may be specified using the object property dcterms:language.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: proceedings paper
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A paper, typically the realization of a research paper reporting original research findings, usually published within an academic proceedings volume.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: rapid communication
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A short rapidly published research article or conference paper, typically reporting significant research results that have been recently discovered, or a brief news item reporting such discoveries.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: wiki
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A collaborative Web manifestation, usually maintained by a project team or group, providing easy-to-edit pages that can be used to accumulate related information for shared use by the group and/or publication.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: library catalog
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The catalog of the holdings of a library, for example that of the Library of Congress (http://catalog.loc.gov/).
A mathematical, graphical or physical representation of some physical reality, conceptual idea or theoretical construct.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: model

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An executive summary is a brief report summarizing a longer formal report, designed to present the key points, conclusions and recommendations arising from the study being reported, for readers too busy to take the time to read the complete report.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: executive summary
internet
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A global system of interconnected computer networks that uses the standard Internet Protocol Suite (TCP/IP) to serve billions of users worldwide. The internet connects millions of private, public, academic, business and governmental computers, that are individually attached to local networks linked together by a broad array of electronic, radio and optical networking technologies to form the internet.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: bibliographic database
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A database providing an authoritative source of bibliographic information, for example PubMed (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed), CrossRef Metadata Search (http://search.crossref.org/) and PubMed Central (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: metadata
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A separate work that provides information describing one or more characteristics of a resource or entity.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: compact disk
CD
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A non-rewritable optical disc used to store digital data.
The realization of a piece of writing on a particular topic, usually published within a periodical publication (e.g. journal, magazine and newspaper).
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: article
supplement
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A supplement to a publication such as a book, journal, magazine or newspaper, additional to the main publication. For example, a colour supplement to a sunday newspaper, or a special supplementary issue of a journal or a journal volume containing invited articles on a special topic, or abstracts or papers presented at a scientific conference.
A written work made especially for a film or television program. Screenplays can be original works or adaptations from existing pieces of writing, for example novels.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: screenplay
web archive
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A snapshots of (part of) the World Wide Web.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: patent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A formal disclosure of a new invention approved by a governmental patent agency, made to register intellectual property rights, and to give exclusive rights to the inventor or assignee to manufacture, use, license or sell the invention for a certain number of years.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: opinion
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An expression of a personal or professional opinion on an issue or topic.
Permits specification of the season of the year, for example spring, summer, autumn and winter in British English.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has season

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An unpublished paper, usually circulated privately among a small group of peers, to provide information or with a request for comments or editorial improvement.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: working paper
technical standard
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An official or public specification of, or requirement for, a technical method, practice, process or protocol that is involved in, for example, manufacturing, computation, electronic communication, or digital media.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sound recording
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The creative work of making an electrical or mechanical recording of sounds, such as the spoken voice, singing, instrumental music, animal vocalizations or sound effects.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: solid state memory
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A digital storage device built entirely from solid electronic materials with no moving parts, e.g. a USB flash drive.
A component of the case for support of a grant application, describing a particular aspect of the work to be undertaken.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: work package

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A database specifically designed for the storage and retrieval of Resource Description Framework (RDF) data consisting of subject-predicate-object triples. A triple store is queried using the RDF query language SPARQL.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: triplestore

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A controlled vocabulary or official list that establishes, for consistency, the authoritative forms of headings, and the preferred terms or proper names to be used, when creating a catalogue or when indexing and searching a set of entities within a defined domain.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: authority file
has issue identifier
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An identifier used to identify a specific issue of a magazine, a journal or other resource.

A file accompanying a published journal article, containing additional information of relevance to the article, typically available from the publisher's web site via a hyperlink from the journal article itself.
